text: Mack Francis Mattingly (born January 7, 1931) served one term as a United States senator from Georgia. He was the first Republican to serve in the U.S. Senate from that state since Reconstruction. Mattingly was born in Anderson, Indiana. He studied at Indiana University. In 1980, Mattingly unseated longtime Democratic Senator Herman Talmadge, which was seen as an historic political upset. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:United States senators from Georgia Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Indiana Category:People from Anderson, Indiana
title: Mack Mattingly
